intro: Rhaphidophora hayi, commonly known as the Zebra Plant, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its distinctive striped leaves, which feature alternating light and dark green bands. The plant belongs to the Araceae family, known for its unique inflorescence structure called a spadix, surrounded by a modified leaf called a spathe. Rhaphidophora hayi thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for indoor gardening and tropical landscapes.
